info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Bertie and southwestern Chowan Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Valhalla, or 13 miles northeast of Windsor. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Bertie and southwestern Chowan Counties, including the following locations... Merry Hill, Mavaton, Edenhouse, Saint Johns, Mount Gould, Macedonia, Hancock and Midway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
